availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dennis J. Halisy (Washington County, Kentucky, physician and colonel)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Native of France. Physician in Washington County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from September 26, 1862 to December 31, 1862. Killed in action on December 31, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 8.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 65.
Find A Grave, "Dennis J. Halisy (1829-December 31, 1862)," Memorial #104883305, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104883305 (accessed June 7, 2019).
